ygData.subject: RE: Instruments vs. Melee quandry
ygData.msgSnippet: as jhenders said before, if you get a pull of multiple mobs that would make your AE damage songs effective, you are pretty much toast and will have to get out
ygData.messageBody:
as jhenders said before, if you get a pull of multiple mobs that would make
your AE damage songs effective, you are pretty much toast and will have to
get out of dodge anyway. multiple pulls of high level mobs means everyone
better concentrate on getting the same mob, one at a time, especially if an
enchanter is messing the others. i haven't used AE damage songs in a long
time, as in dungeons you don't want to pull more than you have, and like i
said you want to concentrate on one mob at a time. therefore my primary
role is party buffing of MR, STR, AGI, and mana, with weapon damage on one
mob as opposed to AE song damage. i am sure L48 and L2 song with lute will
deal a serious amount of AE damage, but its just not viable in high level
dungeon scenarios.

P.S. to jhenders i finally got a ykesha last week to replace one of my wakis
=) pretty close to dueling yaks cause the second hand doesn't proc as much
anyway and waki has same dmg/del ratio.

Shada D'ukal, Level 50 Wood Elf Bard
Erisi Dlarit, Level 22 High Elf Paladin
Tyria, Level 12 High Elf Wizard
Mithaniel Marr Server

> From: "JasonF" <JasonF@...>
>
> You don't make not of the fact that you're doing damage to
> every mob at once
> with the songs. Dual Ykeshas is obviously very strong, but
> you're only
> damaging one mob at a time with them.
>
> Jason A. Farqu´┐¢
